requirements.title: User Account Management
requirements.description: Users can register, log in, reset passwords, and update profile information.

acceptance_criteria.then: Users can register, log in, reset passwords, and update profile information.

requirements.original_intent: Users should be able to register for an account using their email address and password. After registering, users must log in to access their dashboard. If a user forgets their password, they should be able to request a password reset via email. Users should also be able to update their profile information once logged in, but only their name and email address can be changed.

requirements.title: User Registration
requirements.description:
Actor: User

Action: Register for an account

System Behavior: The system allows users to create an account using their email address and password.

Expected Outcome: User account is created successfully.

Observable Result: User receives a confirmation message upon successful registration.

acceptance_criteria.given: A user provides a valid email address and password
acceptance_criteria.when: The user submits the registration form
acceptance_criteria.then: The user account is created and a confirmation message is displayed

acceptance_criteria.given: A user provides an invalid email address or password
acceptance_criteria.when: The user submits the registration form
acceptance_criteria.then: The system displays an error message indicating the issue

inferred_logic: Acceptance criterion (Given: A user provides an invalid email address or password, When: The user submits the registration form) was inferred
Assumption: Email address format is validated.
Assumption: Password meets minimum security requirements.
requirements.original_intent: Users should be able to register for an account using their email address and password. After registering, users must log in to access their dashboard. If a user forgets their password, they should be able to request a password reset via email. Users should also be able to update their profile information once logged in, but only their name and email address can be changed.

requirements.title: User Login
requirements.description:
Actor: User

Action: Log in to the account

System Behavior: The system authenticates the user using their email address and password.

Expected Outcome: User is granted access to their dashboard.

Observable Result: User is redirected to the dashboard upon successful login.

acceptance_criteria.when: The user submits the login form
acceptance_criteria.then: The user is logged in and redirected to the dashboard

acceptance_criteria.when: The user submits the login form
acceptance_criteria.then: The system displays an error message indicating invalid credentials

inferred_logic: Acceptance criterion (Given: A user provides invalid credentials, When: The user submits the login form) was inferred
Assumption: User accounts are stored securely.
requirements.original_intent: Users should be able to register for an account using their email address and password. After registering, users must log in to access their dashboard. If a user forgets their password, they should be able to request a password reset via email. Users should also be able to update their profile information once logged in, but only their name and email address can be changed.

requirements.title: Password Reset
requirements.description:
Actor: User

Action: Request a password reset

System Behavior: The system allows users to request a password reset via email.

Expected Outcome: User receives a password reset email.

Observable Result: User receives an email with instructions to reset their password.

acceptance_criteria.given: A user requests a password reset with a registered email address
acceptance_criteria.when: The user submits the password reset request
acceptance_criteria.then: The system sends a password reset email to the user

acceptance_criteria.given: A user requests a password reset with an unregistered email address
acceptance_criteria.when: The user submits the password reset request
acceptance_criteria.then: The system displays an error message indicating the email is not registered

inferred_logic: Acceptance criterion (Given: A user requests a password reset with an unregistered email address, When: The user submits the password reset request) was inferred
Assumption: Email service is configured and operational.
Assumption: Password reset link is secure and expires after a certain period.
requirements.original_intent: Users should be able to register for an account using their email address and password. After registering, users must log in to access their dashboard. If a user forgets their password, they should be able to request a password reset via email. Users should also be able to update their profile information once logged in, but only their name and email address can be changed.

requirements.title: Profile Update
requirements.description:
Actor: User

Action: Update profile information

System Behavior: The system allows users to update their name and email address after logging in.

Expected Outcome: User's profile information is updated successfully.

Observable Result: User receives a confirmation message upon successful profile update.

acceptance_criteria.given: A user is logged in and provides valid name and email address
acceptance_criteria.when: The user submits the profile update form
acceptance_criteria.then: The user's profile information is updated and a confirmation message is displayed

acceptance_criteria.given: A user is logged in and provides an invalid email address
acceptance_criteria.when: The user submits the profile update form
acceptance_criteria.then: The system displays an error message indicating the email is invalid

inferred_logic: Acceptance criterion (Given: A user is logged in and provides an invalid email address, When: The user submits the profile update form) was inferred
Assumption: User is authenticated before updating profile.
Assumption: Email address format is validated.
requirements.original_intent: Users should be able to register for an account using their email address and password. After registering, users must log in to access their dashboard. If a user forgets their password, they should be able to request a password reset via email. Users should also be able to update their profile information once logged in, but only their name and email address can be changed.

interpretation_notes: The requirements have been decomposed into distinct actions related to user registration, login, password reset, and profile updates.
Inferred standard behaviors for authentication and password reset processes have been documented.

overview.original_intent: Users should be able to register for an account using their email address and password. After registering, users must log in to access their dashboard. If a user forgets their password, they should be able to request a password reset via email. Users should also be able to update their profile information once logged in, but only their name and email address can be changed.

Given a user provides an invalid email address or password, when the user submits registration form, then The system displays an error message indicating the issue [inferred]

Assumed behavior: Assumption: Email address format is validated.
Assumed behavior: Assumption: Password meets minimum security requirements.

Given a user provides invalid credentials, when the user submits login form, then The system displays an error message indicating invalid credentials [inferred]

notes: Assumed behavior: Acceptance criterion (Given: A user provides invalid credentials, When: The user submits login form) was inferred
Assumed behavior: Assumption: User accounts are stored securely.

Assumed behavior: Assumption: Password reset link is secure and expires after a certain period.
